Detailed Description

Contains macros and function definitions for common mathematical functions.

Definition at line 43 of file mathfunctions.h.

#define MatMult ( N,
A,
X,
Y   ) 
Value:
{ \
    int i,j,k;  \
    for (i = 0; i < (N); i++) { \
      for (j = 0; j < (N); j++) { \
        A[i*(N)+j] = 0.0; \
        for (k = 0; k < (N); k++) A[i*(N)+j] += X[i*(N)+k]*Y[k*(N)+j]; \
      } \
    } \
  }

Matrix-Matrix multiplication: A = X Y, where A, X, Y are square matrices of size N, saved as 1D arrays in row-major format.

    A[1] = X[0]*Y[1] + X[1]*Y[3]; \
    A[2] = X[2]*Y[0] + X[3]*Y[2]; \
    A[3] = X[2]*Y[1] + X[3]*Y[3]; \

#define MatVecMult ( N,
y,
A,
x   ) 
Value:
{ \
    int i,j; \
    for (i = 0; i < (N); i++) { \
      y[i] = 0; \
      for (j = 0; j < (N); j++) y[i] += A[i*(N)+j]*x[j]; \
    } \
  }

Matrix-Vector multiplication: y = A x, where x, y are vectors of size N, and A is a square matrix of size N saved as a 1D array in row-major format.

Function Documentation

void FindInterval ( double  a,
double  b,
double *  x,
int  N,
int *  imin,
int *  imax 
)

Function to calculate the grid points corresponding to a given interval

Given an interval , find grid indices imin and imax, such that

where represents a 1-dimensional grid.

Note: This function handles 1-dimensional intervals and grids only.

Parameters:
a Lower bound of interval
b Upper bound of interval
x Array of spatial coordinates representing a grid
N Number of grid points / size of x
imin Lowest grid index within [a,b]
imax Highest grid index within [a,b]

Definition at line 19 of file FindInterval.c.

00027 {
00028   int i;
00029   *imax = -1;
00030   *imin =  N;
00031 
00032   double min_dx = x[1] - x[0];
00033   for (i = 2; i < N; i++) {
00034     double dx = x[i] - x[i-1];
00035     if (dx < min_dx) min_dx = dx;
00036   }
00037   double tol = 1e-10 * min_dx;
00038 
00039   for (i = 0; i < N; i++) {
00040     if (x[i] <= (b+tol)) *imax = i+1;
00041   }
00042   for (i = N-1; i > -1; i--) {
00043     if (x[i] >= (a-tol)) *imin = i;
00044   }
00045 
00046   return;
00047 }

void TrilinearInterpCoeffs ( double  xmin,
double  xmax,
double  ymin,
double  ymax,
double  zmin,
double  zmax,
double  x,
double  y,
double  z,
double *  coeffs 
)

This function computes the coefficients for a trilinear interpolation at a given point (x,y,z) inside a cube defined by [xmin,xmax] X [ymin,ymax] X [zmin,zmax]. The coefficients are stored in an array of size 8 with each element corresponding to a corner of the cube in the following order:
coeffs[0] => xmin,ymin,zmin
coeffs[1] => xmax,ymin,zmin
coeffs[2] => xmin,ymax,zmin
coeffs[3] => xmax,ymax,zmin
coeffs[4] => xmin,ymin,zmax
coeffs[5] => xmax,ymin,zmax
coeffs[6] => xmin,ymax,zmax
coeffs[7] => xmax,ymax,zmax

Parameters:
xmin x-coordinate of the lower-end
xmax x-coordinate of the higher-end
ymin y-coordinate of the lower-end
ymax y-coordinate of the higher-end
zmin z-coordinate of the lower-end
zmax z-coordinate of the higher-end
x x-coordinate of the point to interpolate at
y y-coordinate of the point to interpolate at
z z-coordinate of the point to interpolate at
coeffs array of size 8 (pre-allocated) to store the coefficients in

Definition at line 22 of file TrilinearInterpolation.c.

00034 {
00035     double vol_inv = 1 / ((xmax-xmin)*(ymax-ymin)*(zmax-zmin));
00036     double tldx1 = x - xmin;
00037     double tldx2 = xmax - x;
00038     double tldy1 = y - ymin;
00039     double tldy2 = ymax - y;
00040     double tldz1 = z - zmin;
00041     double tldz2 = zmax - z;
00042 
00043     coeffs[0] = tldz2 * tldy2 * tldx2 * vol_inv;
00044     coeffs[1] = tldz2 * tldy2 * tldx1 * vol_inv;
00045     coeffs[2] = tldz2 * tldy1 * tldx2 * vol_inv;
00046     coeffs[3] = tldz2 * tldy1 * tldx1 * vol_inv;
00047     coeffs[4] = tldz1 * tldy2 * tldx2 * vol_inv;
00048     coeffs[5] = tldz1 * tldy2 * tldx1 * vol_inv;
00049     coeffs[6] = tldz1 * tldy1 * tldx2 * vol_inv;
00050     coeffs[7] = tldz1 * tldy1 * tldx1 * vol_inv;
00051 
00052     return;
00053 }
